question: The 90-90-90 concept is a United Nation’s programme for the diagnosis of which of the following diseases?
explanation: The 90-90-90 is a concept introduced by the United Nation’s programme on HIV/AIDS in 2013. The ultimate goal of the concept is to diagnose 90% of people, the diagnosed 90% will be on antiretroviral treatment and 90% of those who receive antiretroviral will be virally suppressed.
